metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7397 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Async Http Client (aka AHC or async-http-client) before 1.9.0 skips X.509 certificate verification unless both a keyStore location and a trustStore location are explicitly set, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof HTTPS servers by presenting an arbitrary certificate during use of a typical AHC configuration, as demonstrated by a configuration that does not send client certificates. It was discovered that AsyncHttpClient did not properly validate SSL/TLS certificates. An attacker could use this vulnerability to execute a man-in-the-middle attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libasync-http-client-java - 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: async-http-client package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
